required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Egg Intervention During Pregnancy in Indonesia
clinical_study.official_title: Effect on Pregnancy Outcomes, Infant Growth and Development of an Egg Intervention During Pregnancy in Indonesia

lead_sponsor.agency: SEAMEO Regional Centre for Food and Nutrition

collaborator.agency: London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine
International Centre for Research in Agroforestry

clinical_study.source: SEAMEO Regional Centre for Food and Nutrition

brief_summary.textblock: The study consists of two arms: 1) intervention group using eggs as supplementary food given from 2nd trimester of pregnancy to birth, and 2) observational group of pregnant mothers. it aims to assess the effectiveness of improving dietary quality during pregnancy on the epigenetic and stunting related outcomes (growth and development) in infants, who will be followed up until 24 months old

detailed_description.textblock: The study aims to assess the impact of improving dietary quality during pregnancy on the epigenetic and stunting related outcomes in infants. The open-label intervention study would be conducted alongside the observational study in the same study setting by recruitment of additional number (n=153) of pregnant women. Thus, a total of 653 pregnant women would be enrolled in the study; 153 women would be randomized to intervention arm and 500 to the control arm who would form an observational cohort of women and newborns as described above. The intervention group women will be provided one egg three times per week from recruitment (2nd trimester) until term. The control group women will receive standard intervention in the form of Ante Natal Care from village midwives or Public Health Centre (IFA tablet, calcium tablet, nutrition counselling).

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: A total of 653 pregnant women will be recruited from 40 villages in three sub-districts. Pregnant women will be randomly allocated into the intervention or control groups. Pregnant women in the intervention group will receive boiled eggs three times per week from 2nd trimester (16-20 weeks) until delivery.

primary_outcome.description: Z-score of LAZ <-2 SD based on WHO 2006

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of children 10-14 months with impaired fine and gross motor skills
primary_outcome.description: Oxford Neurodevelopment Assessment (OX-NDA) is used to assess fine and gross motor skills among children aged 10 to 14 months

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of children 10-14 months with impaired expressive and receptive language
primary_outcome.description: Oxford Neurodevelopment Assessment (OX-NDA) is used to assess expressive and receptive language among children aged 10 to 14 months

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of children 10-14 months with impaired behavior
primary_outcome.description: Oxford Neurodevelopment Assessment (OX-NDA) is used to assess behavior among children aged 10 to 14 months

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of children 10-14 months with impaired executive function
primary_outcome.description: Oxford Neurodevelopment Assessment (OX-NDA) is used to assess executive function among children aged 10 to 14 months

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of children 10-14 months with impaired empathy
primary_outcome.description: Oxford Neurodevelopment Assessment (OX-NDA) is used to assess empathy among children aged 10 to 14 months

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of children 10-14 months with impaired problem solving
primary_outcome.description: Oxford Neurodevelopment Assessment (OX-NDA) is used to assess problem solving among children aged 10 to 14 months

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of children 10-14 months with impaired attention
primary_outcome.description: Oxford Neurodevelopment Assessment (OX-NDA) is used to assess attention among children aged 10 to 14 months

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of children 10-14 months with impaired social-emotional reactivity
primary_outcome.description: Oxford Neurodevelopment Assessment (OX-NDA) is used to assess social-emotional reactivity among children aged 10 to 14 months

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of children 20-24 months with impaired motor development
primary_outcome.description: INTERGROWTH Neurodevelopment Assessment (INTER-NDA) is used to assess motor development among children aged 20 to 24 months

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of children 20-24 months with impaired cognition
primary_outcome.description: INTERGROWTH Neurodevelopment Assessment (INTER-NDA) is used to assess cognition among children aged 20 to 24 months

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of children 20-24 months with impaired language
primary_outcome.description: INTERGROWTH Neurodevelopment Assessment (INTER-NDA) is used to assess language among children aged 20 to 24 months

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of children 20-24 months with impaired social-emotional development
primary_outcome.description: INTERGROWTH Neurodevelopment Assessment (INTER-NDA) is used to assess social-emotional development among children aged 20 to 24 months

primary_outcome.measure: Scores of CDI vocabulary comprehension scale in children 10-12 months
primary_outcome.description: MacArthur-Bates Communicative Development Inventories (CDI) is used to assess vocabulary comprehension scale among children aged 10 to 12 months

primary_outcome.measure: Scores of CDI vocabulary production scale in children 10-12 months
primary_outcome.description: MacArthur-Bates Communicative Development Inventories (CDI) is used to assess vocabulary production among children aged 10 to 12 months

primary_outcome.measure: Epigenetic state of genes associated with stunting
primary_outcome.time_frame: parents: 72 h after delivery; baby: 72 h after delivery, 24 month
primary_outcome.description: Genome-wide analysis of epigenetic states using the Illumina Infinium Methylation EPIC 850k Bead Chip (EPIC array) will be performed for selected samples from the core cohort. The outcomes will be the epigenetic state of a large number of genes which are associated with child stunting.

primary_outcome.measure: Epigenetic markers of birth anthropometry, adult stature, metabolic state, and cognitive ability
primary_outcome.time_frame: parents: 72 h after delivery; baby: 72 h after delivery, 24 month
primary_outcome.description: All samples (newborn, children 24 mo, parents) will be analyzed using Next Generation Bisulphite Amplicon Sequencing (BSAS) from Illumina MiSeq platform in targeted regions of the genome. The outcomes will be profiles of specific epigenetic markers of birth anthropometry, adult stature, metabolic state, and cognitive ability.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 2nd trimester (16-20 weeks gestation) and 3rd trimester (28-32 weeks gestation) of pregnancy
secondary_outcome.description: All measurements will be taken to the nearest 0.1 kg using standard procedures with SECA weighing machine.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 hours after birth
secondary_outcome.description: All measurements will be taken to the nearest 0.1 kg using standard procedures with SECA weighing machine.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 hours after birth
secondary_outcome.description: All measurements will be taken to the nearest milimeter using standard procedures with SECA stadiometer/infantometer.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Mothers: second and third trimester of pregnancy; children: 6 months (+/- 2 weeks) after delivery; breastmilk: 3 and 6 months (+/- 2 weeks) after delivery
secondary_outcome.description: Nutritional status measured by biochemical assessment to the mothers and children. Both the pregnant mothers and children will be measured for their hemoglobin.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Mothers: second and third trimester of pregnancy; children: 6 months (+/- 2 weeks) after delivery; breastmilk: 3 and 6 months (+/- 2 weeks) after delivery
secondary_outcome.description: Nutritional status measured by biochemical assessment to the mothers and children. Both the pregnant mothers and children will be measured for their serum ferritin

secondary_outcome.description: Nutritional status measured by biochemical assessment to the mothers and children. Both the pregnant mothers and children will be measured for their serum transferrin receptor

secondary_outcome.description: Nutritional status measured by biochemical assessment to the mothers and children. Both the pregnant mothers and children will be measured for their serum zinc

secondary_outcome.description: Nutritional status measured by biochemical assessment to the mothers and children. Both the pregnant mothers and children will be measured for their serum retinol

secondary_outcome.description: Nutritional status measured by biochemical assessment to the mothers for their serum essential amino acids

secondary_outcome.description: Nutritional status measured by biochemical assessment to the mothers and children. Both the pregnant mothers and children will be measured for their serum choline

secondary_outcome.description: Nutritional status measured by biochemical assessment to the mothers and children. Both the pregnant mothers and children will be measured for their serum betaine

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Mothers: second and third trimester of pregnancy
secondary_outcome.description: Nutritional status measured by biochemical assessment to the mothers for their serum vitamin B2

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Mothers: second and third trimester of pregnancy
secondary_outcome.description: Nutritional status measured by biochemical assessment to the mothers for their serum vitamin B6

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Mothers: second and third trimester of pregnancy
secondary_outcome.description: Nutritional status measured by biochemical assessment to the mothers for their serum vitamin D

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Mothers: second and third trimester of pregnancy; children: 6 months (+/- 2 weeks) after delivery; breastmilk: 3 and 6 months (+/- 2 weeks) after delivery
secondary_outcome.description: Subclinical inflammation will be measured by serum CRP in pregnant mothers and children

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Mothers: second and third trimester of pregnancy; children: 6 months (+/- 2 weeks) after delivery; breastmilk: 3 and 6 months (+/- 2 weeks) after delivery
secondary_outcome.description: Subclinical inflammation will be measured by serum AGP in pregnant mothers and children

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Mothers: second and third trimester of pregnancy; children: 6 months (+/- 2 weeks) after delivery; breastmilk: 3 and 6 months (+/- 2 weeks) after delivery
secondary_outcome.description: Nutritional status measured by biochemical assessment to the mothers and children. Both the pregnant mothers and children will be measured for their serum RBP

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Mothers: second and third trimester of pregnancy; children: 6 months (+/- 2 weeks) after delivery; breastmilk: 3 and 6 months (+/- 2 weeks) after delivery
secondary_outcome.description: Nutritional status measured by biochemical assessment to the mothers and children. Both the pregnant mothers and children will be measured for their serum hepcidine

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Mothers: second and third trimester of pregnancy; children: 6 months (+/- 2 weeks) after delivery; breastmilk: 3 and 6 months (+/- 2 weeks) after delivery
secondary_outcome.description: Nutritional status measured by biochemical assessment to the mothers and children. Both the pregnant mothers and children will be measured for their serum homocysteine

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Mothers: second and third trimester of pregnancy
secondary_outcome.description: Gestational diabetes status will be assesed to the mothers for their serum HbA1C

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baby: 1, 6, 24 months of age
secondary_outcome.description: Gut inflammation from fecal will be measured by faecal myeloperoxidase (MPO) using ELISA

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baby: 1, 6, 24 months of age
secondary_outcome.description: Gut inflammation from fecal will be measured by fecal α1-antitrypsin (AAT) using ELISA

secondary_outcome.time_frame: mothers: 3rd trimester (28-32 gestational weeks) of pregnancy; baby: 1, 6, 24 months of age
secondary_outcome.description: Fecal parasites from fecal will be assesed by Kato Katz and confirmed by qPCR

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baby: 1, 6, 24 months of age
secondary_outcome.description: Type of bacteria (Salmonella, Shigella) from fecal will be assesed by culture method

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baby: 1, 6, 24 months of age
secondary_outcome.description: Gut microbiota species (EPEC, ETEC, EHEC, EIEC) from fecal will be assesed using qPCR

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baby: 1, 6, 24 months of age
secondary_outcome.description: Faecal microbiome would be analyzed using 16S RNA sequencing of the V4 region on the Illumina MiSeq and BSAS.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baby: 6 months of age
secondary_outcome.description: Intestinal fatty acid binding protein from serum will be measured using ELISA

arm_group.description: In the observational cohort, pregnant mothers in the 2nd trimester (n=500) will be recruited and they will be followed up until their children are 24 months old. The control group women will receive standard intervention in the form of Ante Natal Care from village midwives (Polindes) or Puskesmas (IFA tablet, calcium tablet, nutrition counselling).
The intervention group women (n=153) will be provided one egg three times per week from recruitment (2nd trimester) until term along with the standard Ante Natal Care.

intervention.description: Eggs are boiled until the white and yolk are firm (ca. 8 minutes) to maintain quality and safety and ensure the eggs are safe for consumption.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Woman is between 16 and 20 weeks of pregnancy based on the date of the first day of her last menstrual period.
- She is 18-40 years of age.
- She is planning to remain in the study area over the next 30 months.
- She is of Sasak ethnicity
Exclusion Criteria:
- She is expecting multiple births.
- She has a known egg allergy.
